title: Denis Coulson
text:
Denis Coulson (born 13 June 1994) is an Irish <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Rugby%20Pro%20D2">Pro D2</a> side <a href="US%20Carcassonne">Carcassonne</a>. He plays as a <a href="Prop%20%28rugby%20union%29">prop</a>.
Early life.
Born in <a href="Dublin">Dublin</a>, Coulson was part of the <a href="St%20Michael%27s%20College%2C%20Dublin%23Rugby">St Michael's College</a> side that won the 2012 <a href="Leinster%20Schools%20Rugby%20Senior%20Cup">Leinster Schools Rugby Senior Cup</a>.
Grenoble.
Coulson represented <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a> in underage rugby, before accepting an academy contract with French club <a href="FC%20Grenoble">FC Grenoble</a> in 2014, who were then coached by ex-Leinster player and former St Michael's College head coach <a href="Bernard%20Jackman">Bernard Jackman</a>. He made 39 appearances for the club over three seasons.
Connacht.
In August 2017, Irish <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a> side <a href="Connacht%20Rugby">Connacht</a> announced that they had signed Coulson ahead of the 2017–2018 season. Coulson is an ex-<a href="Ireland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland U20</a> international.
